channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Dementia housing without locked wards? It's a small but growing movement
item.description: Some senior living communities are caring for people with dementia alongside other residents, not segregated behind locked doors.
item.content:encoded:
Some senior living communities are caring for people with dementia alongside other residents, not segregated behind locked doors.

(Image credit: Ashley Milne-Tyte)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Milne-Tyte

item.title: Trump shifts tone on Epstein files, calling on House GOP to vote for their release
item.description: After months of objections, President Trump is now calling on House Republicans to vote for the release of the Epstein files "because we have nothing to hide."
item.content:encoded: After months of objections, President Trump is now calling on House Republicans to vote for the release of the Epstein files "because we have nothing to hide."
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Epstein survivors in D.C. to demand the release of government files
item.description: Survivors of Jeffrey Epstein's abuse are in Washington to demand the release of the Department of Justice's files. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks to Epstein accuser Annie Farmer.
item.content:encoded: Survivors of Jeffrey Epstein's abuse are in Washington to demand the release of the Department of Justice's files. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks to Epstein accuser Annie Farmer.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Hackers are helping hijackers steal cargo shipments in real life, researchers find
item.description: Researchers say hackers are using their tech skills to help criminals hijack cargo shipments in real life.
item.content:encoded: Researchers say hackers are using their tech skills to help criminals hijack cargo shipments in real life.
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: How women over 30 are rewriting the single mom narrative in America
item.description: Forty percent of babies in the U.S. are born to unmarried mothers. Increasingly, those moms are over 30, at a time when teen pregnancy has fallen off a cliff and births are declining for younger women.
item.content:encoded:
Forty percent of babies in the U.S. are born to unmarried mothers. Increasingly, those moms are over 30, at a time when teen pregnancy has fallen off a cliff and births are declining for younger women.

(Image credit: Maansi Srivastava)
item.dc:creator: Pallavi Gogoi

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump now says that House Republicans should vote for Epstein files' release, Trump says the U.S. may hold talks with Venezuela, Border Patrol agents arrest dozens in Charlotte, North Carolina.
item.content:encoded: Trump now says that House Republicans should vote for Epstein files' release, Trump says the U.S. may hold talks with Venezuela, Border Patrol agents arrest dozens in Charlotte, North Carolina.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Former Meta exec Nick Clegg talks about his new book, 'How to Save the Internet'
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Nick Clegg, Meta's former president of global affairs, about his new book, "How to Save the Internet."
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Nick Clegg, Meta's former president of global affairs, about his new book, "How to Save the Internet."
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Ukraine's $100 million energy scandal triggers resignations and tests Zelenskyy
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he will reform state-owned energy companies after investigators accused his close associates of skimming millions from the country's nuclear power company.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he will reform state-owned energy companies after investigators accused his close associates of skimming millions from the country's nuclear power company.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Congress holds the key to turning the tide on Ohio River Basin pollution
item.description: The vast Ohio River Basin is poised for a multi-year ecological restoration after years of industrial pollution, but only if Congress decides to fund it.
item.content:encoded: The vast Ohio River Basin is poised for a multi-year ecological restoration after years of industrial pollution, but only if Congress decides to fund it.
item.dc:creator: Morgan Watkins

item.title: Alaska wants financially strained districts to take ownership of rural schools
item.description: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling rural schools. But now it wants cash-strapped districts to take on ownership of those buildings in exchange for funding to fix them.
item.content:encoded: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling rural schools. But now it wants cash-strapped districts to take on ownership of those buildings in exchange for funding to fix them.
item.dc:creator: Emily Schwing
